API reference

class trajkit.Trajectory(track_id: str, x: ~numpy.ndarray, t: ~numpy.ndarray | None = None, frame: ~numpy.ndarray | None = None, frame_rate_hz: float | None = None, valid: ~numpy.ndarray | None = None, label: str | None = None, track_features: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>, frame_features: ~typing.Dict[str, ~numpy.ndarray] = <factory>, meta: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>)[source]

Bases: object

A single tracked object (particle, bacterium, etc.)

Core arrays:

  • x: (T, D) positions in D dimensions.

  • t: (T,) time in seconds (optional; can be non-uniform).

  • frame: (T,) frame indices (optional; integer).

  • valid: (T,) boolean mask (optional).

Metadata:

  • label: grouping label (e.g., “passive”, “bacteria”, “janus_active”).

  • track_features: per-trajectory scalars (diameter_um, etc.)

  • frame_features: per-frame arrays (area, theta, intensity, etc.)

  • meta: arbitrary metadata.

property D: int
property T: int
dt() → ndarray[source]

Per-step delta time, length T-1.

frame: ndarray | None = None
frame_features: Dict[str, ndarray]
frame_rate_hz: float | None = None
static from_frame_dataframe(df: DataFrame, *, track_id: str | None = None, D: int | None = None, frame_rate_hz: float | None = None, label: str | None = None, track_features: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, meta: Dict[str, Any] | None = None) → Trajectory[source]

Construct a Trajectory from a per-frame dataframe for ONE track_id. Expected columns: t and/or frame, x0..x{D-1}, optional valid, and ff_* features.

is_uniform_sampling(rtol: float = 1e-05, atol: float = 1e-08) → bool[source]

Checks if dt is (approximately) constant.

label: str | None = None
meta: Dict[str, Any]
msd(*, lags: Iterable[int] | None = None, dims: Iterable[int] | None = None)[source]

Mean squared displacement for this trajectory.

t: ndarray | None = None
time_seconds() → ndarray[source]

Returns time array in seconds. - If t is provided: returns it (can be non-uniform). - Else: computes from frame and frame_rate_hz.

to_frame_dataframe() → DataFrame[source]

Long-form per-frame table. Columns: track_id, t, frame, x0..x{D-1}, valid, ff_* features

track_features: Dict[str, Any]
track_id: str
valid: ndarray | None = None
with_mask(mask: ndarray) → Trajectory[source]

Return a new trajectory containing only samples where mask is True.

x: ndarray
class trajkit.TrajectorySet(dataset_id: str, trajectories: ~typing.Dict[str, ~trajkit.traj.core.Trajectory] = <factory>, units: ~typing.Dict[str, str] = <factory>, calibration: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>, conditions: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>, meta: ~typing.Dict[str, ~typing.Any] = <factory>)[source]

Bases: object

A collection of trajectories from one dataset/experiment.

dataset_id: str
filter(predicate) → TrajectorySet[source]

Return a new TrajectorySet with trajectories for which predicate(tr) is True.

classmethod from_dataframe(df: DataFrame, *, dataset_id: str, track_id_col: str, position_cols: Sequence[str], time_col: str | None = None, frame_col: str | None = None, frame_rate_hz: float | None = None, label_col: str | None = None, track_feature_cols: Sequence[str] = (), frame_feature_cols: Sequence[str] = (), valid_col: str | None = None, units: Dict[str, str] | None = None, calibration: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, conditions: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, meta: Dict[str, Any] | None = None, sort_within_track: bool = True) → TrajectorySet[source]

Build a TrajectorySet from a long-form per-frame DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • df – Per-frame table containing coordinates and timing information.

  • dataset_id – Identifier for the resulting TrajectorySet.

  • track_id_col – Column holding the per-track identifier.

  • position_cols – Ordered columns that make up the coordinate vector.

  • time_col – Optional column giving timestamps in seconds.

  • frame_col – Optional column giving frame indices.

  • frame_rate_hz – Required when using frame_col without time_col.

  • label_col – Optional column providing per-track labels.

  • track_feature_cols – Columns treated as per-track scalars (must be constant per track).

  • frame_feature_cols – Columns copied into frame_features for each trajectory.

  • valid_col – Optional boolean column marking valid samples.

  • sort_within_track – Sort each track by time/frame before constructing.

get(track_id: str) → Trajectory[source]

meta: Dict[str, Any]

Mean squared displacement over all trajectories.

summary_table() → DataFrame[source]

One row per trajectory: track_id, label, T, D, duration, plus track_features (tf_*).

trajectories: Dict[str, Trajectory]
units: Dict[str, str]
trajkit.load_trajectory_set(folder: str | Path, *, tracks_filename: str = 'tracks.parquet', index_filename: str = 'tracks_index.parquet', meta_filename: str = 'meta.json', frame_rate_hz: float | None = None) → TrajectorySet[source]

Reconstruct a TrajectorySet from saved parquet + meta. If frame_rate_hz is provided, it will be applied to trajectories that lack explicit t.

trajkit.save_trajectory_set(ts: TrajectorySet, folder: str | Path, *, tracks_filename: str = 'tracks.parquet', index_filename: str = 'tracks_index.parquet', meta_filename: str = 'meta.json') → None[source]
Writes:
folder/

tracks.parquet (per-frame long table) tracks_index.parquet (per-track summary + tf_*) meta.json (dataset metadata, units, calibration, conditions)
